section.title: API Reference
section.para: This section describe interface that KEDR COI library provides for use in the kernel code.

section.title: Header File
section.para: The API is declared in the header file that should be included for use any of function or definition described in this document:
section.programlisting: #include <kedr-coi/operations_interception.h>

section.title: Interceptor structure
section.para: Opaque structure which represents interceptor for a particular type of objects.
section.programlisting: struct kedr_coi_interceptor;

section.title: struct kedr_coi_operation_call_info
section.para: Contains information about particular callback operation call. Used as parameter to interception handlers.

varlistentry.listitem: Returning address of this operation call. Should be used instead of '__builtin_return_address(0)', which will return address inside intermediate operation, that is probably not what one wants.

Pointer to the original callback operation. Should be used instead of direct reading that pointer from object structure, because latter contains pointer to the intermediate operation, not the original one.

section.title: struct kedr_coi_pre_handler
section.para: Represent function which should be called before corresponded callback operation.

varlistentry.listitem: Offset of the pointer to the callback operation inside object/operations structure.

Pointer to the function to be called before callback operation.
Function should take same arguments as callback operation plus argument of type 'struct kedr_coi_operation_call_info*'. Function shouldn't return any value.

section.title: kedr_coi_pre_handler_end
section.para: End marker of the array of pre-handlers.
section.programlisting: #define kedr_coi_pre_handler_end {.operation_offset = -1}

section.title: struct kedr_coi_post_handler
section.para: Represent function which should be called after corresponded callback operation.

varlistentry.listitem: Offset of the pointer to the callback operation inside object/operations structure.

Pointer to the function to be called after callback operation.
Function should take same arguments as callback operation plus argument of returning type of callback operation(if callback operation returns any value) plus argument of type 'struct kedr_coi_operation_call_info*'. Function shouldn't return any value.

section.title: kedr_coi_post_handler_end
section.para: End marker of the array of post-handlers.
section.programlisting: #define kedr_coi_post_handler_end {.operation_offset = -1}

section.title: struct kedr_coi_payload
section.para: Represent interception information from one module for one object type.

varlistentry.listitem: Module containing code of interception functions. This module will be prevented from unload while interceptor is started.
Array of the pre-handlers. Last element in that array should have '-1' in the 'operation_offset' field ('kedr_coi_pre_handler_end' may be used as last element).
Array of the post-handlers. Last element in that array should have '-1' in the 'operation_offset' field ('kedr_coi_post_handler_end' may be used as last element).

section.title: kedr_coi_payload_register
section.para: Add interception information contained in the payload to the interceptor.
Make all pre- and post-handlers, contained in the payload's 'pre_handlers' and 'post_handlers' fields, be known to the interceptor. Return 0 on success and negative error code otherwise.
Same payload shouldn't be registered twice.
An attempt to register payload while interceptor is started returns '-EBUSY'.

section.title: kedr_coi_payload_unregister
section.para: Remove interception information listed in the payload from the interceptor. Payload should be previously registered using 'kedr_coi_payload_register'.
Make all pre- and post-handlers, contained in the payload, be not known to the interceptor. Return 0 on success and negative error code otherwise.
An attempt to unregister payload which previously wasn't registered returns '-EINVAL'.
An attempt to unregister payload which is used by interceptor in 'started' state returns '-EBUSY'.

section.title: kedr_coi_interceptor_start
section.para: Move interceptor to 'started' state.
section.programlisting: int kedr_coi_interceptor_start(struct kedr_coi_interceptor* interceptor);
section.para: Fix list of interception handlers of the interceptor and allow to add objects for watch by the interceptor. Return 0 on success and negative error code on fail.
Shouldn't be called when interceptor already in 'started' state.

section.title: kedr_coi_interceptor_stop
section.para: Move interceptor to 'initialized' state.
section.programlisting: void kedr_coi_interceptor_stop(struct kedr_coi_interceptor* interceptor);
section.para: Release list of interception handlers, allowing it to be changed by registering/deregistering payloads. If any object is watched at this moment, stop to watch it. Also, if 'trace_unforgotten_object' parameter of interceptor constructor was not NULL, call 'trace_unforgotten_object' for every such object.
If called when interceptor is already in 'initialized' state, do nothing.

section.title: kedr_coi_interceptor_watch
section.para: Tell interceptor to watch an object.
Interceptor will intercept object's callback operations, calling interception handlers from registered payloads. Return 0 on success and negative error code on fail.
If called when interceptor is not in the 'started' state, return -ENODEV.
If object is already watched, return 1 on success and negative error code on fail.

note.para: Interception of the object's callback operations is implemented via changing object's operations in some fasion.
If object's callback operations are changed outside of the library, interception of the object's callback operations will be losed until this function is called again.

section.title: kedr_coi_interceptor_forget
section.para: Tell interceptor to forget an object.
Interceptor won't intercept object's callback operations any more. Return 0 on success, negative error code on fail. If object is not watched, return 1.
If called when interceptor is not in the 'started' state, return -ENODEV.

section.title: kedr_coi_interceptor_forget_norestore
section.para: Tell interceptor to forget the object but do not revert changes, made when object become watched.
Free resources used for watching the prototype object. Return 0 on success, negative error code on fail. If object is not watched, return 1.
If called when interceptor is not in the 'started' state, return -ENODEV.
Further using callback operations of this object leads to undefined behaviour.

section.title: struct kedr_coi_intermediate_info
section.para: Contains information about interception of particular callback operation call. Used by intermediate operation.

varlistentry.listitem: Original callback operation of the object.
Array of pre-handlers which should be called for this callback operation. Last element in this array is NULL. NULL in this field means an empty array.
Array of post-handlers which should be called for this callback operation. Last element in this array is NULL. NULL in this field means an empty array.

section.title: kedr_coi_get_intermediate_info
section.para: Return interception information for intermediate operation. Should be used only in intermediate operation implementation.
Fill 'kedr_coi_intermediate_info' structure with information about callback operation call. Return 0 on success and negative error code on fail.

section.title: struct kedr_coi_intermediate
section.para: Describe intermediate operation for callback operation.

varlistentry.listitem: Offset of the callback operation inside object/operations structure.
Pointer to the function implementing intermediate operation.

If not 0, determine group which that intermediate operation is belonged to.
If any intermediate operation from the group is used as replacement for original callback operation, then all other intermediate operations from the same group are used.
Normally, intermediate operation is used as replacement only when some interception handler is registered for it.
For usage example, see (TODO).

section.title: kedr_coi_interceptor_create
section.para: Create interceptor for objects which contain pointer to the structure with their callback operations.
section.programlisting: struct kedr_coi_interceptor* kedr_coi_interceptor_create(const char* name, size_t operations_field_offset, size_t operations_struct_size, struct kedr_coi_intermediate* intermediate_operations, void (*trace_unforgotten_object)(void* object));
section.para: 'name' is a name of interceptor created, used in some error reports.
'operations_field_offset' and 'operations_struct_size' parameters describe object's geometry(see (TODO)).

'intermediate_operations' is an array of intermediate operations. Last element in the array should have 'operation_offset' field set to -1. Every callback operation, which interception is supported, should have intermediate operation.
If not NULL, 'trace_unforgotten_object' will be called for every watched object when interceptor is being stopped(see (TODO)).
Return new interceptor on success. If interceptor cannot be created, return NULL.

section.title: kedr_coi_interceptor_create_direct
section.para: Create interceptor for objects which contain pointers to their callback operations.
section.programlisting: struct kedr_coi_interceptor* kedr_coi_interceptor_create_direct(const char* name, size_t object_struct_size, struct kedr_coi_intermediate* intermediate_operations, void (*trace_unforgotten_object)(void* object));
section.para: 'name' is a name of interceptor created, used in some error reports.
'object_struct_size' is a size of the object structure(see (TODO)).

'intermediate_operations' is an array of intermediate operations. Last element in the array should have 'operation_offset' field set to -1. Every callback operation, which interception is supported, should have intermediate operation.
If not NULL, 'trace_unforgotten_object' will be called for every watched object when interceptor is being stopped(see (TODO)).
Return new interceptor on success. If interceptor cannot be created, return NULL.

section.title: kedr_coi_interceptor_destroy
section.para: Destroy interceptor, freeing all resourced used by it.
section.programlisting: void kedr_coi_interceptor_destroy( struct kedr_coi_interceptor* interceptor);
section.para: Shouldn't be called when interceptor is started.

section.title: Foreign interceptor structure
section.para: Opaque structure which represents foreign interceptor for a particular types of objects(prototype and normal ones).
section.programlisting: struct kedr_coi_foreign_interceptor;
section.para: When created, foreign interceptor has 'binded' interceptor - normal interceptor, which is used for watch the objects created from prototype objects.

Foreign interceptor has not 'start' and 'stop' function analogies of normal one. Instead, foreign interceptor is started or stopped automatically when its binded interceptor is started or stopped correspondingly.

section.title: kedr_coi_foreign_interceptor_watch
section.para: Tell foreign interceptor to watch a prototype object.
All objects created from this prototype object will be automatically watched by the binded interceptor. Return 0 on success and negative error code on fail.
If called when interceptor is not in the 'started' state, return -ENODEV.
If object is already watched, return 1 on success and negative error code on fail.

note.para: Watching of prototype object is implemented via changing foreign callback operations(callback operations which is copied to the object created from prototype) in some fasion.
If these operations are changed outside of the library, automatically watching objects created from this one will not work until this function is called again.

section.title: kedr_coi_foreign_interceptor_forget
section.para: Tell foreign interceptor to forget a prototype object.

Objects created from this prototype object will no longer be watched by the binded interceptor automatically. Return 0 on success, negative error on fail. If prototype object is not watched, return 1.
If called when interceptor is not in the 'started' state, return -ENODEV.

section.title: kedr_coi_foreign_interceptor_forget_norestore
section.para: Tell foreign interceptor to forget a prototype object but do not revert changes, made when the object became watched.
Free resources used for watching of the prototype object. Return 0 on success, negative error on fail. If prototype object is not watched, return 1.
If called when interceptor is not in the 'started' state, return -ENODEV.
Futher objects creation from this prototype object leads to undefined behaviour.

section.title: kedr_coi_bind_prototype_with_object
section.para: Make binded interceptor watched the object, if it is created from prototype object which is watched by the foreign interceptor. Should be called only from intermediate operation for foreign interceptor.
section.programlisting: int kedr_coi_bind_prototype_with_object( struct kedr_coi_foreign_interceptor* interceptor, void* prototype_object, void* object, size_t operation_offset, void** op_chained);
section.para: Return 0 on success or negative error code on fail.
Also set 'op_chained' pointed to callback operation which should be called then. If cannot define next operation, set 'op_chained' to ERR_PTR().
If 0 is returned, 'op_chained' is alrways correct pointer to function(not an error indicator). But 'op_chained' may be correct pointer even in case of error returned.

section.title: struct kedr_coi_foreign_intermediate
section.para: Describe intermediate operation for the foreign interceptor.

varlistentry.listitem: Offset of the callback operation inside object/operations structure.
Pointer to the function implementing intermediate operation.

section.title: kedr_coi_foreign_interceptor_create
section.para: Create foreign interceptor for prototype objects which contain pointer to the structure with their callback operations.
'interceptor_indirect' is a binded interceptor for created one. Only indirect interceptor may be binded, using direct interceptor for this purpose leads to undefined behaviour.
'name' is a name of interceptor created, used in some error reports.
'foreign_operations_field_offset' is offset of the pointer to operations struct inside prototype object.

'intermediate_operations' is an array of intermediate operations. Last element in the array should have 'operation_offset' field set to -1. Every callback operation which is called just after object is created from prototype should have intermediate operation. Usually there is only one such callback operation.
If not NULL, 'trace_unforgotten_object' will be called for every watched object when interceptor is being stopped.
Return new interceptor on success. If interceptor cannot be created, return NULL.
Shouldn't be called when binded interceptor is started.

section.title: kedr_coi_foreign_interceptor_destroy
section.para: Destroy foreign interceptor, freeing all resourced used by it.
section.programlisting: void kedr_coi_foreign_interceptor_destroy( struct kedr_coi_foreign_interceptor* interceptor);
section.para: Shouldn't be called when interceptor is started(that is, when binded instrumentor is started).
